summary: Worker threads in the TypeScript SDK use round-robin dispatch for workflows, which can lead to unbalanced load distribution. Implementing a least-loaded worker selection strategy would improve thread utilization and overall system balance.
userImpact: Unbalanced worker threads can cause some threads to become overloaded while others remain underutilized, reducing throughput and increasing latency for workflow execution.
rootCause: Current round-robin dispatcher does not account for workflow eviction, leading to unbalanced thread loads over time.
proposedFix: Refactor dispatcher to select worker thread with least number of active workflows instead of using round-robin allocation.
resolutionDetails: Implemented least-loaded worker selection strategy to replace round-robin dispatch mechanism.
keyQuote: A simple refactoring of this dispatcher to choose the worker thread with least workflows would improve the overall balancing of work between the threads.
